name: Statue of Liberty
brief: A symbol of freedom and democracy, located in New York Harbor.

name: Taj Mahal
brief: A white marble mausoleum, considered one of the most beautiful buildings in the world.

name: Eiffel Tower
brief: An iconic iron lattice tower located in Paris, France.

name: Great Wall of China
brief: A series of fortifications made of stone, brick, tamped earth, wood, and other materials, it is one of the most extensive and ancient defensive walls in the world.

name: Pyramids of Giza
brief: An ancient complex of tombs and monuments, including the Great Pyramid, built as tombs for the country's pharaohs.

name: Christ the Redeemer
brief: A colossal statue of Jesus Christ in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, considered the largest Art Deco statue in the world.

name: Machu Picchu
brief: An ancient Incan city in the Andes mountains of Peru, known for its sophisticated dry-stone walls and scenic location.

name: Colosseum
brief: An ancient amphitheater in Rome, Italy, known for its gladiator battles and public spectacles.

name: Petra
brief: An ancient city in Jordan famous for its rock-cut architecture and water conduit system.

name: Angkor Wat
brief: A temple complex in Cambodia, the largest religious monument in the world, originally dedicated to the Hindu god Vishnu.

name: Mausoleum at Halicarnassus
brief: A tomb built in Halicarnassus (modern-day Bodrum, Turkey) for Mausolus, a satrap in the Persian Empire.

name: Stonehenge
brief: A prehistoric monument in Wiltshire, England, consisting of a ring of standing stones.

name: The Parthenon
brief: A temple on the Athenian Acropolis dedicated to the goddess Athena, considered one of the greatest achievements of ancient Greek architecture.

name: Moai Statues of Easter Island
brief: Large stone statues (moai) created by the Rapa Nui people on Easter Island in eastern Polynesia.

name: Alhambra
brief: A palace and fortress complex located in Granada, Spain, known for its intricate Islamic architecture.

name: Sydney Opera House
brief: An iconic performing arts center in Sydney, Australia, known for its distinctive sail-like design.

name: Scott's Hut
brief: A historic site on Ross Island in Antarctica, used as a base for British Antarctic expeditions.

name: Uluru (Ayers Rock)
brief: A large sandstone rock formation in the Northern Territory of Australia, sacred to the Aboriginal people and listed as a UNESCO World Heritage site.

name: Mount Erebus
brief: An active volcano located on Ross Island in Antarctica, known for its persistent lava lake within the summit crater.
